posts.cooked: I am brand new to frc and I am interested in learning how to program a robot  and just code in general. I am  wondering what are some good resources/websites to learn coding. Thanks for your time.

posts.name: Abdullah Khaled
posts.cooked:
Don’t worry! I’m glad you found the CD community, as there are lots of smart people here who can help you. I would recommend looking into these threads: Hi i am new to programming and i need help - Technical / Programming - Chief Delphi As a beginner frc programmer what concepts or things should i learn or learn to do first? - Technical / Programming - Chief Delphi

As for resources, reading WPILib’s official documentation (they’re the main “library” or code base teams use) may be overwhelming but it has a lot of good information.

Also, if you don’t know Java (assuming your team uses it, which almost all do), I would look into basic Java tutorials (e.g. W3Schools , though there are probably plenty out there by now)

As for resources specific to hardware (e.g. motors and such), the CTRE ( Phoenix 6 Documentation ) and REV documentation have you covered for most of that (ask your team what system you use).

For resources made by teams, check out 9496 LYNK’s Library of Knowledge (LLK) and 3847 Spectrum’s training resources . I’m probably missing some, but these are the ones that come off of the top of my head

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: I speak for the trees, not for my team.

posts.custom_user_title: I speak for the trees, not for my team.

posts.name: garyk
posts.cooked:
Ask your team what language is used on the ‘bot, C++, Java, or Python. Not JavaScript, it’s different.

Avoid the endless arguments of “My favorite language is better than yours.”

https://spectrum.ieee.org/top-programming-languages-2024

posts.name: Fatema M
posts.cooked:
Hi

I would recomend figuring out what language your team codes in, that will make learning how to write robot code much easier.

My team, Team 3061, Huskie Robotics, releases an Open Source library each year that prevents us from rewriting the same robot code and is focused on a swerve-based drivetrain.

It’s called 3061 Lib , and our lead mentor releases videos explaining every part of 3061 lib, so I would highly reccomend watching those videos as it explains a lot of robot-specific code. We have commands in there, subsystems such as an Arm, Elevator, Manipulator, and Shooter. The videos that go through 3061 lib will be helpful, so if you do look at 3061 lib, make sure to watch the above videos!

We use 3061 Lib as our base code for each year, so understanding it might help you to build your own code for the build season or just understand how robot code works.

By the way, I would reccomend that you look at this AFTER you know the basic concepts of coding so the robot-specific code will be easier to understand.

Reach out with any questions!
Thanks everyone! I will look into this!
